text: my name is Sal chiavari I work for
Edwards Lifesciences as their chief
information officer Edwards Lifesciences
their focus is on heart valves and heart
therapies it's it's life or death right
and so you know for us when we take a
look at what we need to do we take a
look at the services that we provide
stepping up to those challenges are
really really critical and so we don't
take them lightly so we had to go
through a process to really understand
you know do we upgrade this all
ourselves did we take the time and the
effort to invest and when we looked at
it we said it would probably take us a
lot longer a lot more costly and just
trying to get the talent aligned to do
it would be a major challenge for us and
we needed to move quickly and so that's
what we started a look at infrastructure
as a service what we saw with AWS was a
lot more process intensive a lot more
features than we were seeing with the
competition and in fact the migration
path seemed to be something that from a
support standpoint and from a capability
standpoint we felt a lot more
comfortable at AWS had what we needed we
actually completed the entire migration
three and a half months and that means
with every production system that we
have is now up in cloud not only was AWS
better from a security standpoint but it
was quantumly better I think a major
benefit is really why work on something
that's not your stated business you know
data centers today to me are a commodity
item I hate to say it's not a value add
but actually it's you know it's like
electricity you just needed to run in
the background somewhere it is in
customer facing it isn't something that
delivers value other than the fact that
you got to have a team that's focused on
it and delivers and you don't have to
sit there worrying about where am I
going to get my next server where I'm
going to get the funding to actually
capital funding to be able to to support
the next project how's the air
conditioning in that environment how the
electricity in that environment where's
my redundancy you don't have to worry
about that I think that's a that's a
major ease off of your mind I'll let you
focus on the right things that you
should be focused on AWS provides a
solution for us that just eliminates the
traditional disaster cover environment
and although we will still be doing our
level of testing having a disaster
recovery service having having to send
backup scenarios that we had before no
longer relevant and in fact what I told
the CEO after the transition was that he
never had to worry about disaster
recovery again
[Music]
